info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Grant, southwestern Huntington and southeastern Miami Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sweetser, or 7 miles west of Marion, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sweetser around 340 PM EDT. Marion around 350 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Van Buren. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 264 and 275. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
